attributes.action: say NO to overseas Premier League games!
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Over recent decades loyal fans have put up with changing kick-off times and rapid ticket price inflation to support the team they love, the team that's in their blood.

The Premier League has consistently moved further and further away from its loyal fan base to make a smuch money for the people that run the Premier League and the Chairmen of the Big Four.

This is not only bad for the fans; it’s bad for the lower league teams who face a growing inequality with the top. Today (8th Feb), when the Premier League announced its money making gesture to play a round of games overseas, Bournemouth of League 1 went into administration with £4 million of debt -  or the wages of 2 Chelsea players.

This decision to play a round of games abroad would be the last kick in the teeth for the English fans that made the league what it is. It would rip out whatever soul remains in the Premier League.

Football is a passion and a game, not a commodity. This is wrong.

Please aid our campaign to stop this.

Thankyou.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
